answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
A question similar to yours was asked once before on the Knowledge Network. You can see the link to that and its answer below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/20383
I also found examples of places that have begun to implement paperless policies. You can contact them directly for more information about their efforts to go paperless.
Washtenaw County, MI won an award for their work on going green through paperless solutions.
http://icma.org/en/Article/100680/Washtenaw_County_MI_Receives_Award_for_Going_Paperless
I also found a case study about the Colorado Housing and Finance Authority which recently conducted an ROI to see how paperless technology would affect them.
http://www.kofax.com/case-studies/colorado-housing-and-finance-authority-chfa-achieves-rapid-roi-through-capture-enabled-enterprise-content-management/
I have included a link to Paperless Project, a website which has more general information about eliminating paper from your offices.
http://www.thepaperlessproject.com/about.html
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text: An Alliance member has been tracking their ROI from going paperless.  Have any other cities/counties tracked their short and long-term savings?
title: Paperless ROI?
